title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:00  has joined #xwiki 00:00  has quit 00:02  is now known as 03:16  has quit 03:22  has quit 03:40  has joined #xwiki 03:41  has quit 03:52  has quit 06:39  has quit 06:39  has quit 06:39  has quit 06:39  has quit 07:02  has joined #xwiki 07:02  has joined #xwiki 07:02  has joined #xwiki 07:02  has joined #xwiki 07:51  has quit 07:56  has joined #xwiki 07:56  has quit 07:56  has joined #xwiki 07:58  has joined #xwiki 08:30  has quit 08:54  has joined #xwiki 08:54  has joined #xwiki 09:00  has joined #xwiki 09:00  goof morning 09:00  s/goof/good/ ;) 09:01  has joined #xwiki 09:14  has joined #xwiki 09:38  has joined #xwiki 10:10  has joined #xwiki 10:18 <+cjdelisle> heh 10:18  :) 10:37  mflorea: good morning. what's left for the release? 10:37 <+mflorea> vmassol: nothing, I'm writing the announcement mail 10:38  ok great 10:38 <+mflorea> you mean the 3.0M3 release 10:38  yes 10:44  has joined #xwiki 10:49 <+sburjan> hello everybody 10:52  hi sburjan 10:53 <+sburjan> I wanted to ask you ... should I better test M3 or latest snapshot ? I saw a lot of commits from jvelociter in this weekend, which aren't included in the M3 10:55  latest snapshot is better IMO 10:56 <+sburjan> IMO too 10:56 <+sburjan> okay, latest snapshot it is 10:58  jvelociter: hello. Found one issue in search suggest 10:58  pressing enter doesn't work anymore.... 10:58  ex: I type "dash" and press enter. Nothing happens 11:04 <+jvelociter> vmassol: strange, I ensured it was working 11:04 <+jvelociter> that should be a bug 11:05  tmortagne: "Java properties, split out of the INI lexer (#445)" could be interesting for xwiki.cfg and xwiki.properties code snippets 11:05  "Performance improvements in the HTML formatter (#523)." this too :) 11:05 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep 11:05 <+tmortagne> not this one 11:05 <+tmortagne> we are not using their formatter 11:05  ah 11:05 <+tmortagne> formatter==renderer 11:05  ok 11:05 <+tmortagne> we are producing XDOM 11:06  indeed 11:07 <+tmortagne> I'm hesitation to commit it in 3.0 branch or not, WDYT ? 11:08  hmmm indeed would be best to wait I think 11:08  we're going to create the branch for 3.0 on next Monday 11:08  OTOH 11:08  it only dpeends on how confident we are (ie how much testing we do) 11:08 <+tmortagne> yes probably, it's not like it was fixing some blocker bug for us or something and the new lexers are not really strategic things 11:26 <+mflorea> vmassol: can you update the Freshmeat and Wikimatrix after the 3.0M3 release? Thanks :) 11:26  mflorea: yep ok 11:44  has joined #xwiki 11:50  has quit 11:51  mflorea: done for wikimatrix. Waiting for your blog post for doing the freshmeat one. Are you doing wikipedia? 11:52 <+sburjan> vmassol: does Dashboards have a place on JIRA ? 11:52 <+mflorea> vmassol: I asked Sergiu to do Wikipedia. The blog post of xwiki.org is done 11:52  k 11:52  sburjan: I don't think so, just ui & templates 11:52 <+sburjan> ok 11:53 <+sburjan> can I start reporting ors hould I wait until Anca stabilizes it further ? 11:53  you can start to report IMO 11:54  cannot hurt 11:54  has joined #xwiki 11:57  mflorea: freshmeat done 11:57 <+mflorea> vmassol: thanks! 12:22 <+jvelociter> vmassol: sburjan where can I find roadmap archives ? 12:23 <+jvelociter> the link on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap is broken 12:24 <+sburjan> http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/RoadmapArchives 12:24 <+sburjan> let me fix the link 12:24  has joined #xwiki 12:25 <+sburjan> fixed 12:34 <+jvelociter> thanks 12:43  has quit 12:52  has quit 13:13  jvelociter: how hard would it be to autodiscover the user's operating system on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download so that the suggested download matches your OS? 13:14 <+jvelociter> vmassol: not very hard 13:14 <+jvelociter> (not 100% reliable either) 13:14  they do it on http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/download/index.html 13:15 <+jvelociter> you can type : 13:15  http://www.jetbrains.com/js2/checkOS.js 13:15 <+cjdelisle> clever too, it outsmarted my spoofed user agent 13:15 <+jvelociter> navigator.appVersion 13:15 <+jvelociter> or 13:15 <+jvelociter> navigator.platform 13:15 <+jvelociter> in firebug console 13:16 <+jvelociter> for example 13:16 <+jvelociter> hehe 13:16 <+jvelociter> nice 13:16 <+jvelociter> ah yes but appVersion is not userAgent 13:16 <+jvelociter> so they did nothing special 13:17 <+jvelociter> but you should be able to spoof appVersion as well 13:17  well that's ok 13:17 <+jvelociter> yeah 13:17 <+jvelociter> if you spoof that kind of things I guess you can accept OS suggestions are not relevant for you :) 13:18 <+cjdelisle> yea, I only do it because I'm using a svn checkout of FF and itherwise it'd be a fingerprint. 13:41  has joined #xwiki 13:51  has joined #xwiki 14:16  has joined #xwiki 14:22 <+sburjan> IMO a discussion would be nice around this topic : http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6105 14:25  has joined #xwiki 14:25  has quit 14:35  tmortagne: seems we cannot style headers 14:35  (% class="downloadCategory genericCategory" %) 14:35  == Other downloads == 14:35  doesn't seem to work 14:35  we probably have a jira issue already for this.... 14:36 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think  we are supposed to be able to, looks like a bug 14:36 <+tmortagne> i don't remember it 14:36 <+tmortagne> let me chec tests 14:36 <+tmortagne> check 14:37  wait 14:37  it seems it's correct, it must be the CSS 14:37  

Other downloads

14:37  evalica must have done the styling on a div 14:37  instead of on the h2 14:37 <+tmortagne> hmm actually we don't have any wikimodel unit test with header parameters it seems 14:38 <+evalica> .downloadCategory h2 14:38  (% class="downloadCategory genericCategory" %)((( 14:38  == Other downloads == 14:38  ))) 14:38  that works 14:38 <+tmortagne> ok if it's working i will add a unit test on wikimodel side 14:38  would have been nicer not to have to add the div evalica 14:39  h2.downloadCategory? or is it because you reuse the downloadCategory class? 14:40 <+evalica> should work 14:40 <+evalica> h2.downloadCategory 14:41 <+evalica> and also have h2.genericCategory  to give the specific color 14:45  evalica: I forced you 14:45  (don't save please ;)) 14:45 <+sburjan> :) 14:52  has quit 14:56  has quit 15:02  has quit 15:18  has joined #xwiki 15:23  has joined #xwiki 15:29  Hello, I have a ldap group mapping question: if my ldap group has not a memberUid attr and instead of it has an gidNumber that User entry must also inform, how can i configure xwiki to make this user-group association? Thanks for advance 15:30  has quit 15:36  ok OS auto select should work now 15:36  http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download 15:36  someone on windows here? 15:37  (works on mac) 15:37  if someone can test on linux too would be great 15:38 <+tmortagne> vmassol: works on ubuntu 15:38  cool 15:39  has joined #xwiki 15:51  should we direct to http://www.apache.org/dev/contrib-email-tips.html (or include it altogether) on our MailingList page? 15:56  has joined #xwiki 15:56  has joined #xwiki 16:00 <+jvelociter> sounds good 16:00  has quit 16:12  evalica: hi :) 16:13 <+evalica> re ihalip 16:23  atlassian hasn't added support to convert xwiki syntax .20 yet apparently: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/UWC-478 ;) 16:24  btw they have a rank field in their jira instance which is intriguing 16:25  btw they're using a nice forum app with points (see legend on the right): http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=43259 16:26  top users are avail here: http://forums.atlassian.com/index.jspa?categoryID=1 16:29  nice thread: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257303027� ;) 16:31 <+evalica> :) 16:31 <+evalica> anyway he is solo answering his question 16:33  xwiki applied for gsoc again i see 16:33  they're using jive apparently: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257270630� 16:34 <+evalica> ihalip: yes - we are still waiting for confirmation that we are selected - have you seen the projects list? 16:34  yep 16:34  not going to apply though, i'm looking for some hardcore c++ :) 16:34 <+evalica> from what I know you participated last year for another project? 16:35  yeah 16:35  last year, it was KDE 16:35  this year... who knows? 16:35 <+evalica> yeap ... nice 16:35  and shouldn't your nickname be emoraru? :P 16:36 <+evalica> :) maybe 16:36 <+evalica> anyway - good luck at GSOC - maybe you'll consider XWiki too 16:36  thanks 16:36  hope you get accepted 16:37 <+evalica> me too 16:39  i saw the calendar application project 16:39  isn't it in the ideas list for... 3? 4 years? :) 16:40 <+evalica> and will still be until it gets developed by a student :) 16:40  haha 16:40  i may have conviced someone to look into that 16:41 <+evalica> yea - it's a popular project 16:58  has quit 17:01  has joined #xwiki 17:07  has joined #xwiki 17:07  has quit 17:07  has joined #xwiki 17:11  has quit 17:41  has quit 17:49  has quit 18:31  has joined #xwiki 19:19  has quit 19:21  has joined #xwiki 19:39 <+jvelociter> Hi cjdelisle 19:40 <+jvelociter> is XWIKI-2874 still in your plans ? 19:44 <+cjdelisle> Yes but I don't expect it to be done to the existing storage engine, 19:46 <+cjdelisle> I do plan to do exactly the same thing (actually on a larger scale, multiple documents at a time) but I would like to use the new xwiki-store system rather than making it a patch against XHS. 19:59  has quit 20:02  has quit 20:06  has joined #xwiki 20:16  has quit 20:34 <+jvelociter> cjdelisle: the patch attached to the issue would not be usable currently against XHS ? 20:35 <+cjdelisle> It would but it would require a period of debugging and testing before it can go mainstream. IMO it's more worthwhile to rewrite it externally. 20:39 <+jvelociter> cjdelisle: well I'd be interested to test it if that can help 20:39  has quit 20:40 <+jvelociter> thing is I'm afraid if it's part of a bigger plan of refactoring it might need 2, 3 or more cycles before it's available 20:40 <+jvelociter> while if it's not that far from being stable on XHR it could be available in say 1 cycle 20:40 <+jvelociter> but now I totally support a plan with a new xwiki-store :) 20:42 <+cjdelisle> I think a new loadXWikiDoc would take the same amount of verification whether it is inside of XHS or outside 20:58  has quit 21:12 <+jvelociter> yes, but what takes time is implementing the new xwiki-store 21:12 <+jvelociter> relatively 21:12 <+jvelociter> (at least I think) 21:19 <+cjdelisle> Well it will have to depend on hibernate and on the old context but I don't think it will take all that long. 21:27  cjdelisle: hi. BTW what's the state of the new attachment store? Does it have known bugs/limitations at this point? Can it be used in production? 21:29 <+cjdelisle> No known bugs, needs further testing. Been distracted by cjdns. I think it would be a good idea to change the parameters in xwiki.cfg and add some more integration tests. 21:30 <+cjdelisle> If there's anything to go wrong now, it will be in the integration between store and xwiki-core. 21:30  wdym by change parameters? 21:30  (I'm not sure about making it the default if that's what you mean) 21:30 <+cjdelisle> set the attachment store to file so that automated testing is dirercted at it. 21:30  but we should definitely have some functional tests for it 21:30  ldap tests change the config for ex 21:31  so we can do the same 21:31 <+cjdelisle> Ahh, I was unaware that there was a way to change xwiki.cfg from selenium. 21:31  it's not from seleinum 21:31  but since we start xwiki 21:31  we can do whatever we want 21:32 <+cjdelisle> If we change it though it will prevent testing of the old attachment store. I'm not sure of a way around that though. 21:33  no no 21:33  it should have its own functional tests 21:33  right now we have about 7-8 different types of functional tests 21:34  here http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/trunk/distribution-test/ 21:34  we can add another dir there for the new attachment store for ex 21:34 <+cjdelisle> Ok and add a new class of functional tests which will be applied both to the new store and the old? 21:34  ah you want to share the same tests for both is that it? 21:35 <+cjdelisle> it makes sense to test them both then we can compare them. 21:35  yes we can do that 21:35  indeed 21:35 <+cjdelisle> I have some tests on cjdns where I had to prove my parser was the same as the ball of mud it replaced, that's what I did. 21:35  it could be a maven profile or we stop and restart the container in 2 different test suites 21:36  that's easy to do actually 21:36 <+cjdelisle> What is the secret so I can write it down and I don't have to spend a day digging through maven documentation? 21:36  http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/enterprise/trunk/distribution-test/ldap-tests/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ldap/framework/XWikiLDAPTestSetup.java 21:37  (thomas did this, just looking it up now) 21:37 <+cjdelisle> Just run the tests twice with different parameters? 21:38  yes 21:38  have 2 test suites 21:38  btw we'll need to upgrade to junit4 at some point, just did it on rendering/ 21:39  (by upgrade I mean using junit4 @RunWith rather than use old junit3 TestSuite) 21:39 <+cjdelisle> Can these tests alone be in junit4 without porting all other tests over? 21:41  sure 21:41  for ex I ported only rendering/ test to junit4 ATM 21:41  going to do commons next and then some in platform/core 21:41 <+cjdelisle> cool. I am embarassingly ignorant of maven and junit workings. 21:42  I can help if you have questions 21:42  (at least try ;)) 21:42 <+cjdelisle> Thanks, I'm sure I will. 21:43 <+cjdelisle> Also thanks for the suggestion of a new "class" of integration tests. 21:43 <+cjdelisle> I was a bit sunk on how to go about that. 21:45  yes would be great to have some functional tests for it 21:45  I'm going to try to find some time to do some manual tests for it tomorrow 21:45  since it would be awesome to release it as working for XE 3.0 final 21:46  that would be one major feature of XE 3.0 21:46  running perfs tests on it is a must do at some point too 21:46 <+cjdelisle> I think we will be able to make it for 3.0. Not so sure on whether it is wise to turn it on by default but we can cross that bridge when it comes. 21:47  to test file locking when there are multiple threads for ex 21:47  yes I wouldn't turn it on by default in 3.0 21:47  but I'd advertise it 21:47  then if we get good feedback we'll see what we do 21:48 <+cjdelisle> There is a very nice unit test for locking but I need to make it a little less strict because one kind of behavior cannot br proven what order things will happen. 21:48  ok 21:49  cjdelisle: btw is it in the release notes of 3.0M3 21:50 <+cjdelisle> nope, not if it depended on me :( 21:50  let's check 21:50  I think you implemented the trash storage in 3.0M3 right? 21:51 <+cjdelisle> I did. 21:51  that's significant enough to be in the R 21:51  s/R/RN/ 21:51  I don't see it 21:51 <+cjdelisle> I will add it then. 21:51  do you have the jira issue? Do you think you could add some blurb about it... 21:51  ok 21:51  thanks 21:52  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise30M3 21:52 <+cjdelisle> XWIKI-6071 21:52 <+cjdelisle> argh 21:52  still open? 21:53  you should close it if it's done (especially since it's released) 21:53 <+cjdelisle> just did 21:53  :) 21:53  that's why it wasn't in the RN 21:53  marius couldn't see it 21:54 <+cjdelisle> the reason why I have been so horribly absent: 21:54 <+cjdelisle> user@debo8:~$ dig @127.0.0.1 -p 5353 01901520f60cf0d7ed23521288cf5bf640bb7608.dht 21:54 <+cjdelisle> ;; ANSWER SECTION: 21:55 <+cjdelisle> 01901520f60cf0d7ed23521288cf5bf640bb7608.dht. 30 IN A 208.91.129.187 21:55 <+cjdelisle> :) 21:55 <+cjdelisle> just looking up a name like that is 17,000 lines of code. 21:56  that's a bit cryptic for me but I'll trust you that it's awesome! :) 21:56  17K LOC is a lot 21:56 <+cjdelisle> replaces the entire dns infrastructure when it is done. 21:56  ah ok indeed 21:56  got to go, bb later 21:57 <+cjdelisle> And not all of that code is mine, there are some libraries that are copy-paste linked. 22:01  has quit 23:42  has quit
